Then set a range using 50% increments (one below and two above) of initial seeding density.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"afotk","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"oatq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"17vd2","text":"Determine desired cell culture media conditions to be tested. description: {"blocks":[{"key":"7l8ko","text":"This protocol details the cell growth optimization for integrated live-cell and endpoint viablility drug screening assay on a 96-well plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"128ue","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8031h","text":"To accurately integrate live-cell imaging and endpoint viability, the user must define conditions which promote cell growth, prevent over-confluence, and fall within the detectable linear range of the endpoint cell viability assay. This protocol is designed to identify the optimal cell seeding density and media conditions to be used for integrated live-cell imaging and endpoint metabolic ATP viability assays for 72-hour drug screens using 96-well plates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"egvv3","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9kpfm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2d4tc","text":"This protocol is designed to identify optimized seeding conditions for a single cell line so that it is compatible for sequential live-cell imaging and endpoint viability assays in a 72-hour drug screen. Successfully optimized seeding densities and conditions meet the following basic criteria:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":294}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e6m6v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aab4k","text":"Live-cell imaging displays healthy cells which are growing throughout 72-hours.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":79}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4q1tc","text":"Cells aren’t overconfluent at 72-hour endpoint. (We recommend a final confluence ≤ 60%, however, some slow growing cell lines may need to be seeded more densely and, in these cases, avoid conditions where cells are growing in clumps at experimental endpoint).","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":259}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ehotk","text":"The range of seeding densities (at each condition) fall within the detectable linear range of the endpoint viability assay. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":124}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ei1n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1iein","text":"The user may find a range of options that fit these criteria. In these cases, it is to the user’s discretion to select the conditions that align best with their study objective. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":178}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3l3eu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dg0rd","text":"Tips for data analysis:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9gk4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8hvmo","text":"Track confluence throughout live-cell imaging steps- at endpoint export confluence data for all wells as an average of each of the images. This will allow you to calculate growth rate as well as final average endpoint confluence.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":229}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7svm","text":"To determine if seeding densities are within the detectable linear range of the endpoint viability assay, Create an X-Y scatterplot where raw luminescence values averaged for each replicate is graphed at each seeding density. Perform a linear regression or linear curve fit to calculate the R2 (a value which denotes how well the data “fits” the linear curve). Note: R2 values range from 0-1 where ≥ 0.9 is considered a good fit.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":429},{"style":"sup","offset":292,"length":2},{"style":"sup","offset":368,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2pcqp","text":"If users are planning to optimize multiple cell lines for comparative drug screens, then it is recommended to select conditions which allow the most similarities across cell lines. I.e. if one cell line is only within an optimized range when 2% FBS is used but another is in an optimized ranged at either 2% or 5% FBS, proceed with both cell lines using 2% FBS to limit variables.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":380}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7mj7m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"24ncd","text":"*This protocol may be iteratively repeated and adjusted to obtain the user’s desired 72-hour cell growth rate and final confluence.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
